intro: Cyphia aspergilloides, commonly known as the rough-spored Cyphia, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form and produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. Its leaves are leathery and covered in fine, glandular hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The plant thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats.
